content.html: for reference - this is a reincarnation of pull request #1079. The comments there might be still useful.

content.raw:
I have a bunch of nitpicky UX stuff I'll lay down here. It's not necessarily all related to this pull request, and it's not critical from a technical standpoint--just some preliminary user data for @spaepcke :)

The bounding box for selecting joints is huge. It seems a bit excessive because a large amount of the bounding area is empty, and it doesn't match up with the area that will select the joint when clicked. Maybe the BB should just be as wide as the endpoints of the joints?

The "Add" button under "Custom" is also excessively large. It also seems awkward that it's under its own drop-down menu--are there more plans for buttons undre "Custom"?

Is the joint inspector functionality implemented yet or is it just a stub? I tried changing the "Anchor" fields, expecting them to change the attachment point of the joint, but it didn't do anything after hitting Apply or OK...

-1000 and 1000 seem like unrealistic default values for a revolute joint.

Two links connected by a Universal joint end up flying into the distance when the model is saved and the Model Editor is closed. Two links connected by a screw joint stay still but fly into the distance when disturbed by translation or rotation. These may be physics engine issues, but I theorize giving each joint reasonable default values may improve user experience...

The changing text next to the checkboxes was confusing for me, I think just a checkbox next to "Static" or "Auto-disable" is enough. A checkbox next to "False" could mean "check to make this value false" OR "this value is currently false"

It's not immediately clear what "Auto-disable" does.
content.html:
I have a bunch of nitpicky UX stuff I'll lay down here. It's not necessarily all related to this pull request, and it's not critical from a technical standpoint--just some preliminary user data for @spaepcke :)

The bounding box for selecting joints is huge. It seems a bit excessive because a large amount of the bounding area is empty, and it doesn't match up with the area that will select the joint when clicked. Maybe the BB should just be as wide as the endpoints of the joints?

The "Add" button under "Custom" is also excessively large. It also seems awkward that it's under its own drop-down menu--are there more plans for buttons undre "Custom"?

Is the joint inspector functionality implemented yet or is it just a stub? I tried changing the "Anchor" fields, expecting them to change the attachment point of the joint, but it didn't do anything after hitting Apply or OK...

-1000 and 1000 seem like unrealistic default values for a revolute joint.

Two links connected by a Universal joint end up flying into the distance when the model is saved and the Model Editor is closed. Two links connected by a screw joint stay still but fly into the distance when disturbed by translation or rotation. These may be physics engine issues, but I theorize giving each joint reasonable default values may improve user experience...

The changing text next to the checkboxes was confusing for me, I think just a checkbox next to "Static" or "Auto-disable" is enough. A checkbox next to "False" could mean "check to make this value false" OR "this value is currently false"

It's not immediately clear what "Auto-disable" does.

content.raw:
Thanks for the list, Jackie. I don't have access to wafflebot from home, so I can't check all of this stuff today. I'll comment on the things I remember from yesterday.

The bounding box is indeed too large. Jackie's suggestion seems like a good thing to try.

I had the same confusion when the text changed next to the checkboxes. I don't think it's necessary to change the text based on checked state.
content.html:
Thanks for the list, Jackie. I don't have access to wafflebot from home, so I can't check all of this stuff today. I'll comment on the things I remember from yesterday.

The bounding box is indeed too large. Jackie's suggestion seems like a good thing to try.

I had the same confusion when the text changed next to the checkboxes. I don't think it's necessary to change the text based on checked state.

content.raw:
I haven't played with this in-depth yet, but here are some impressions so far:

* Deleting one link that is attached to another via a joint deletes both links. I think it's better to delete only the selected link and the joint
* Did we decide to change the "Part" terminology back to "Link"? If so, the popup should be updated. 
* I might try to come up with a better indicator on the joint handles for which is the parent and which is the child. I suppose people will learn, but at first, it seems totally random...
* Allow editing of Joint and Joint Type names in Inspector
* Joint Inspector: Anchor, Axis1, Limit headers look grayed out. Is that intentional? If not, let's make them look "normal"
content.html:
I haven't played with this in-depth yet, but here are some impressions so far:

  • Deleting one link that is attached to another via a joint deletes both links. I think it's better to delete only the selected link and the joint
  • Did we decide to change the "Part" terminology back to "Link"? If so, the popup should be updated.
  • I might try to come up with a better indicator on the joint handles for which is the parent and which is the child. I suppose people will learn, but at first, it seems totally random...
  • Allow editing of Joint and Joint Type names in Inspector
  • Joint Inspector: Anchor, Axis1, Limit headers look grayed out. Is that intentional? If not, let's make them look "normal"

content.raw:
I made a few updates:

* 'Add' button resized.
* Default joint limits set to -pi and pi.
* Fixed problem with universal joints.
* Clarified the state of 'auto-disable' and 'static'. I've modified the label next to the checkbox. Now it says 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.
* Fixed problem with mouse/key handlers that was preventing the model insertion in the main window. 

False alarms:

* 'anchor' fields seems to work.
* Deleting one link attached to another with a joint. The first click selects the whole model, you need a second click for selecting a specific link.
content.html:
I made a few updates:

  • 'Add' button resized.
  • Default joint limits set to -pi and pi.
  • Fixed problem with universal joints.
  • Clarified the state of 'auto-disable' and 'static'. I've modified the label next to the checkbox. Now it says 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.
  • Fixed problem with mouse/key handlers that was preventing the model insertion in the main window.

False alarms:

  • 'anchor' fields seems to work.
  • Deleting one link attached to another with a joint. The first click selects the whole model, you need a second click for selecting a specific link.

content.raw: Humm I'm always confused about joints. Is the anchor supposed to be the joint's [pose](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/sdformat/api/dev.html#pose375) element, i.e. "Pose offset from child link frame to joint frame (expressed in child link frame)."? So each joint has only one, independently of how many axes it has, right?
content.html: Humm I'm always confused about joints. Is the anchor supposed to be the joint's pose element, i.e. "Pose offset from child link frame to joint frame (expressed in child link frame)."? So each joint has only one, independently of how many axes it has, right?

content.html: you're right, it shouldn't have an index. Changed anchor to pose in a37c852.

content.raw:
I noticed a tiny bug:

1. On the main window, insert a shape

2. Enter the model edit, insert a shape

3. Start making a joint, select the 2nd shape as parent

4. If you click and drag on the other shape, the camera orbits (as long as you move the mouse on top of the shape) and on release the orbit indicator (yellow sphere) remains on the shape. And at some point the shape actually became selected, I'm not able to reproduce though.

5. If you click and drag on the ground plane, nothing happens, i.e. you can't orbit.
content.html:
I noticed a tiny bug:

  1. On the main window, insert a shape

  2. Enter the model edit, insert a shape

  3. Start making a joint, select the 2nd shape as parent

  4. If you click and drag on the other shape, the camera orbits (as long as you move the mouse on top of the shape) and on release the orbit indicator (yellow sphere) remains on the shape. And at some point the shape actually became selected, I'm not able to reproduce though.

  5. If you click and drag on the ground plane, nothing happens, i.e. you can't orbit.

content.html: fixed 57c5305

content.raw:
Ah... Sorry, but now I found a series of weird behaviours... In the same situation as above (parent already chosen, choosing child):

A. Press the wheel button on the ground and drag it upwards until the mouse is over the sky, the orbiting stops. 

B. It's also not possible to orbit from below the ground, so if you end up under the ground you're stuck there.

C. Dragging on top of the the parent part does work, but the yellow indicator shows up on the last position it was, instead of the current target.
content.html:
Ah... Sorry, but now I found a series of weird behaviours... In the same situation as above (parent already chosen, choosing child):

A. Press the wheel button on the ground and drag it upwards until the mouse is over the sky, the orbiting stops.

B. It's also not possible to orbit from below the ground, so if you end up under the ground you're stuck there.

C. Dragging on top of the the parent part does work, but the yellow indicator shows up on the last position it was, instead of the current target.

content.html:
1. Create a revolute joint

  2. Open inspector, change it to revolute2, click Apply

Fields for Axis2 don't show up until I close the inspector and open it again.

Conversely, changing from revolute2 to revolute, Axis2 doesn't disappear until reopening the inspector.

content.raw: I think this one is an issue with `ModelCreator.cc`'s filters, not the `JointMaker`, so maybe it's out of scope here. On translate mode, if you drag one of the translation handles fast enough that the mouse moves out of the handle and on top of the ground plane, the camera starts moving. So you're manipulating and orbiting the view at the same time...
content.html: I think this one is an issue with ModelCreator.cc's filters, not the JointMaker, so maybe it's out of scope here. On translate mode, if you drag one of the translation handles fast enough that the mouse moves out of the handle and on top of the ground plane, the camera starts moving. So you're manipulating and orbiting the view at the same time...

content.raw: fixed 74100fd
content.html: fixed 74100fd

content.raw:
This is creating a bug for me.

1. Insert 2 parts

2. Change to translate mode

3. Click on one part

4. Holding `Ctrl`, click on the other part - the whole model becomes selected, which is bad

5. It's even worse if with the model selected, you press `Delete`. All parts disappear, and if you try to insert a new part, Gazebo crashes with this message:

~~~
***** Internal Program Error - assertion (this->dataPtr->sceneNode) failed in void gazebo::rendering::Visual::SetPosition(const gazebo::math::Vector3&):
/home/louise/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc(1542): Visual SceneNode is NULL
~~~

Without the `if (this->manipMode == "select")` check though, on step 4 the clicked part becomes highlighted while the manipulator remains on the first part. I fixed it by triggering the arrow mode inside the else  after line 710:

~~~
        if (!g_arrowAct->isChecked())
          g_arrowAct->trigger();
~~~

What do you think?
content.html:
This is creating a bug for me.

  1. Insert 2 parts

  2. Change to translate mode

  3. Click on one part

  4. Holding Ctrl, click on the other part - the whole model becomes selected, which is bad

  5. It's even worse if with the model selected, you press Delete. All parts disappear, and if you try to insert a new part, Gazebo crashes with this message:

***** Internal Program Error - assertion (this->dataPtr->sceneNode) failed in void gazebo::rendering::Visual::SetPosition(const gazebo::math::Vector3&):
/home/louise/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc(1542): Visual SceneNode is NULL

Without the if (this->manipMode == "select") check though, on step 4 the clicked part becomes highlighted while the manipulator remains on the first part. I fixed it by triggering the arrow mode inside the else after line 710:

        if (!g_arrowAct->isChecked())
          g_arrowAct->trigger();

What do you think?

content.raw: ok I see, I added the check in order to get rid of yellow orbit indicators but it's kind of hacky anyway so I removed it. Instead I tried changes in 28f8e15 and seems to work ok.
content.html: ok I see, I added the check in order to get rid of yellow orbit indicators but it's kind of hacky anyway so I removed it. Instead I tried changes in 28f8e15 and seems to work ok.

content.raw:
The main issue was main window models getting the highlighted triangles on snap mode.

A minor issue was the cursor changing to a pointing hand when hovering main window models, suggesting it might be able to select then when in fact it isn't.

And to make the two previous ones work, I had to send the event to `ModelManipulator` for RTS modes, otherwise dragging a manipulation handle on top of main window models would orbit the camera at the same time.
content.html:
The main issue was main window models getting the highlighted triangles on snap mode.

A minor issue was the cursor changing to a pointing hand when hovering main window models, suggesting it might be able to select then when in fact it isn't.

And to make the two previous ones work, I had to send the event to ModelManipulator for RTS modes, otherwise dragging a manipulation handle on top of main window models would orbit the camera at the same time.

content.raw: I see, sounds good. The current mouse filters are too error prone. Maybe one thing to think about in the future is to extend model manipulator with the ability to accept bitmasks so it can interact with specific groups of models/links/visuals.
content.html: I see, sounds good. The current mouse filters are too error prone. Maybe one thing to think about in the future is to extend model manipulator with the ability to accept bitmasks so it can interact with specific groups of models/links/visuals.

content.raw: +1 for bitmasks. I would add snap to the list. Align seems to work fine with any group of visuals you send in.
content.html: +1 for bitmasks. I would add snap to the list. Align seems to work fine with any group of visuals you send in.
